contest-event.event-date:
May 11, 1895 D Tyldesley Contest
Tyldesley Contest 10 Test Piece Contest Tyldesley Contest tyldesley-contest
Aurora [Round]
Tyldesley, Lancashire 12 bands competed
Prizes: £10, £7, £5, £2, £1 The Judge was A. D. Keate, Professor of Music from Denton in Manchester. The contest took place on a football field off Elliot Street, Tyldesley. The Bands formed up on Castle Street, then proceeded via Elliot Street and Well Street to the field for the quickstep contest. The prizes were as follows:- 1st prize £10, 2nd prize £7, third prize £5 fourth prize £3 and fifth prize £1. There were also two prizes for the quickstep, 1st prize £1 and 2nd prize 10s, won by Wingates Temperance and Pemberton Old respectively.
April 14, 2012, 7:33 p.m. June 15, 2019, 10:30 p.m.
1 Wingates Band William Rimmer
2 Pemberton Old Wigan DW Band William Rimmer
3 Atherton Public Prize Band Fred Durham
4 Westleigh William Rimmer
5 Rochdale Old J. Whittaker
